meanings.definition: To manipulate the boundaries of an electoral constituency in order to favor one party or class.
meanings.sent1: Politicians may gerrymander districts to gain an unfair advantage.
meanings.sent2: It is illegal to gerrymander voting districts for political gain.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox tried to gerrymander the race by taking a shortcut.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a gerrymandered map, twisting and turning to suit her needs.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick was to gerrymander the audience's attention away from his sleight of hand.

meanings.sent1: The gerrymander of the district caused controversy.
meanings.sent2: After the gerrymander, the election results were questioned.
meanings.sent3: The gerrymander at the town hall meeting left everyone puzzled.
meanings.sent4: The gerrymander of opinions in the group discussion was evident.
meanings.sent5: The gerrymander of the puzzle pieces made it impossible to complete.

meanings.definition: A district or constituency that has been gerrymandered.
meanings.sent1: The new district was a clear gerrymander.
meanings.sent2: Living in a gerrymander can affect your voting power.
meanings.sent3: The gerrymander of the neighborhood boundaries led to confusion.
meanings.sent4: The gerrymander of the map made it look like a jigsaw puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The gerrymander of the school district caused uproar among parents.
